intro: Impatiens namchabarwensis, commonly known as the Namchabarwa impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the Himalayan region of Nepal and India. It is a member of the Balsaminaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, showy flowers that typically range in color from pink to red. The plant grows in moist, shaded habitats at high altitudes, often in mountainous regions. It has opposite, ovate leaves with hairy surfaces and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds. Due to its restricted distribution and unique habitat, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
